tournament.name: Steel City Spectacular Duel for Duals - Excalibur Events

decks.notes: The deck focuses on utilizing creatures like Nadu, Winged Wisdom alongside Nomads en-Kor to create a combo that can be protected with cards like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares. With cards like Brainstorm and Ponder for card selection, the deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and protect them from removal spells. The inclusion of Green Sun's Zenith allows for tutoring key creatures, while Teferi, Time Raveler helps to disrupt opponents' strategies. The mana base is designed to provide flexibility and consistency in casting the deck's spells.

The main concept of this Dimir Tempo deck is to disrupt opponents' game plans while maintaining a quick and aggressive tempo. Using cards like Thoughtseize, Force of Will, and Daze to control the game, while also applying pressure with creatures like Murktide Regent and Brazen Borrower. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's resources and win the game quickly before they can establish their own strategy. With a combination of removal, disruption, and efficient threats, this deck looks to outmaneuver opponents and secure victories in Legacy 1 vs 1 matches.

This deck focuses on utilizing the combo potential of Delighted Halfling and Nomads en-Kor to generate large amounts of mana and draw through the deck quickly. The key strategy is to efficiently tutor for combo pieces using Green Sun's Zenith and Ponder, while also utilizing disruption spells like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares to control the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of control elements like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Teferi, Time Raveler help to protect the combo while providing additional value. Land choices like Karakas and Lush Portico further enhance the deck's overall game plan.

The deck focuses on using various spells and creatures to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures, then utilizing reanimation spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead to bring them back onto the battlefield. It also includes disruption elements like Thoughtseize and Daze to disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect its own combo pieces. The goal is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with big creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier while also controlling the game with cards like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Force of Will.

The deck focuses on utilizing Cephalid Illusionist in combination with Nomads en-Kor to mill through your deck quickly and set up the win condition by bringing back creatures with Dread Return or utilizing Thassa's Oracle to win the game on the spot. It also includes support cards like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Urza's Saga to help facilitate the combo. The deck runs a control package with counterspells like Force of Will and removal spells like Swords to Plowshares to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt and control your opponent's plays while steadily applying pressure with efficient creatures and removal spells. By utilizing cards like Thoughtseize, Daze, Force of Will, and Fatal Push to disrupt their game plan and protect your own threats, you can gain tempo advantage and close out the game quickly. The deck also aims to maintain card advantage and selection with cantrips like Ponder and Brainstorm, while leveraging powerful threats like Murktide Regent and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to close out the game.

The main concept of this deck is to generate infinite mana through the use of artifacts such as Grim Monolith and Urza's Tower, allowing for the quick casting of powerful spells like Kozilek's Command and Ugin, the Eye of the Storms. Mystic Forge and Mishra's Research Desk provide card advantage and the ability to manipulate the top of the library, while Karn, the Great Creator and Tezzeret, Cruel Captain offer additional artifact synergy. The combination of fast mana generation, card advantage, and powerful spells make this deck a formidable force in the Legacy format.

The deck focuses on utilizing the combo potential of Nadu, Winged Wisdom alongside Nomads en-Kor to manipulate card draw and life gain. It also includes control elements like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares to protect the combo pieces. The deck aims to control the game with card advantage and removal spells while setting up the combo win condition. It also includes a variety of lands to support the overall strategy and ensure consistent mana production. The deck looks to efficiently assemble its combo pieces and disrupt opponents' strategies to secure victory.

The deck aims to quickly assemble the combo of Cephalid Illusionist, Nomads en-Kor, and either Dread Return or Narcomoeba to mill the library and win the game by either using Thassa's Oracle or Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to draw the last card. It utilizes protection spells like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares to protect the combo pieces and disruption like Daze and Prismatic Ending to disrupt opponent's game plan. The deck also includes card selection and manipulation with Brainstorm and Ponder, as well as mana fixing with fetch lands and dual lands.

This Dimir Tempo deck focuses on quickly disrupting the opponent's strategy while applying pressure with efficient creatures. It utilizes cards like Daze and Force of Will to counter key spells, along with disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push. The deck also includes threat cards like Delver of Secrets and Nethergoyf to close out games quickly. The mana base is designed to support the deck's two-color nature while also utilizing Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana base. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to maintain control of the game while applying pressure to overwhelm the opponent.

The main concept of this UWx Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy through a combination of hand disruption, counter spells, and removal spells. The deck aims to control the game by using cards like Thoughtseize, Force of Will, and Swords to Plowshares to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while applying pressure with efficient threats like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares, Murktide Regent, and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. The deck also includes a mix of card advantage engines like Brainstorm and Lórien Revealed to help maintain resources and stay ahead in the game.

This UWx Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage. Utilizing cards like Force of Will, Spell Pierce, and Teferi, Time Raveler, the deck aims to control the board and prevent the opponent from executing their strategy. The deck also includes card draw spells like Brainstorm and Ponder, as well as versatile removal options like Swords to Plowshares and Prismatic Ending. With a mix of threats, disruption, and card advantage, this deck looks to outmaneuver the opponent and emerge victorious.

The main idea of this deck is to use the combo between Nomads en-Kor and Nadu, Winged Wisdom to create a loop that allows you to draw your entire deck and win the game. The deck also includes protection with cards like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares, along with card selection and ramp with cards like Brainstorm and Green Sun's Zenith. This combo-based strategy aims to overwhelm your opponent quickly and efficiently while ensuring you have the resources and protection needed to execute your game plan successfully.

This deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Reanimate, then bringing them back onto the battlefield for a low cost. By combining the ability to control the opponent's hand with disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Will, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up its own combo-reanimator strategy. The deck includes a mix of threats and disruption to keep the opponent off balance and capitalize on the explosive potential of reanimating massive creatures early in the game.

The deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Brainstorm, then bringing them back onto the battlefield with Reanimate and Animate Dead for explosive plays. It includes disruption and protection spells like Force of Will and Thoughtseize to ensure the combo goes off successfully. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with high-powered creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier, or control the board with spells like Murktide Regent and Brazen Borrower. The deck aims to win the game through efficient and explosive combos revolving around graveyard recursion.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with key creatures, then using spells like Reanimate to bring them back into play for a powerful combo. It also includes disruption cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to control the game and protect the combo. The land base is optimized for consistency and to support the deck's strategies. Overall, the deck aims to efficiently reanimate powerful creatures and disrupt the opponent's game plan to secure a win.
